{"step_by_step_thinking": "Phonological awareness is the ability to recognize and work with sounds in spoken language. While it is an important skill for children to develop, especially in preparation for learning to read, it does not necessarily require specialized training in every preschool child. Many children develop phonological awareness naturally through exposure to language, songs, and rhymes. Specialized training may be beneficial for children who are struggling with phonological awareness or who have language disorders, but it is not indicated for every child.", "answer_choice": "B"}
